metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10018 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebKitGTK through 2.26.4 and WPE WebKit through 2.26.4 (which are the versions right before 2.28.0) contains a memory corruption issue (use-after-free) that may lead to arbitrary code execution. This issue has been fixed in 2.28.0 with improved memory handling.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10018` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.28.0-0ubuntu0.18.04.3').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
